title: 112_s3077
content:
The Act is titled the "Pro Football Hall of Fame Commemorative Coin Act". The Pro Football Hall of Fame was established to honor individuals who have made outstanding contributions to professional football, preserve its history, educate the public about the sport's development, and promote its positive values. The Hall of Fame opened on September 7, 1963, inducting a charter class of 17 players, coaches, and contributors including legends like Sammy Baugh, Red Grange, and Jim Thorpe. The Pro Football Hall of Fame, established in 1963, honors individuals like Sammy Baugh, Red Grange, and Jim Thorpe. There are 273 members inducted, each represented by a bronze bust, gold jacket, and ring. The museum has welcomed 9 million visitors and undergone multiple expansions and renovations. The Pro Football Hall of Fame, established in 1963, honors individuals like Sammy Baugh, Red Grange, and Jim Thorpe. With 273 members inducted, the museum houses the world's largest collection on professional football, including over 20,000 three-dimensional artifacts and 20 million pages of documents. It reaches a worldwide audience of nearly 15 million people annually through various channels. SEC. 3. COIN SPECIFICATIONS. The Secretary of the Treasury will mint and issue $5 gold coins, $1 silver coins, and half-dollar clad coins with specific weights, diameters, and metal compositions. The coins minted under this Act will weigh 11.34 grams, have a diameter of 1.205 inches, and meet the specifications for half-dollar coins as outlined in title 31, United States Code. They will also be legal tender and considered numismatic items. The coins minted under this Act will have a design emblematic of professional football, with inscriptions including the year 2016 and words like "Liberty" and "In God We Trust". The design will be selected by the Secretary in consultation with the Commission of Fine Arts and the Pro Football Hall of Fame, and reviewed by the Citizens Coinage Advisory Committee. SEC. 5. ISSUANCE OF COINS.

Coins minted under this Act will be issued in uncirculated and proof qualities at a single designated facility of the United States Mint. The Secretary is authorized to issue these coins only during a 1-year period starting on January 1, 2016. SEC. 6. SALE OF COINS.

The coins issued under this Act will be sold by the Secretary at a price equal to the face value of the coins, the surcharge provided in section 7(a), and the cost of designing and issuing the coins. Bulk sales will be made at a reasonable discount, and prepaid orders will be accepted at a discount. All sales of coins issued under this Act include surcharges of $35 per $5 coin, $10 per $1 coin, and $5 per half-dollar coin. Surcharges received are promptly paid to the Pro Football Hall of Fame for construction and renovation. The Hall of Fame is subject to audit requirements for the amounts received. No surcharge may be included for the issuance of any coin under this Act. No surcharge may be included for the issuance of any coin under this Act if it would exceed the annual commemorative coin program issuance limitation. The Secretary of the Treasury may issue guidance for this limitation.
